text: Mansour Akram Ojjeh (25 September 1952 - 6 June 2021) () was a French Saudi Arabian-born businessman. He owned part of TAG. Ojjeh was the CEO of TAG, which owns 14.32% of the McLaren Group. He also owned 10% of the upmarket jewellers Asprey and Garrard. In late 2013, Ojjeh had a double lung transplant after suffering with idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis. Ojjeh died on 6 June 2021, at the age of 68.McLaren Racing announces death of shareholder Mansour Ojjeh, 68 ==References== Category:1952 births Category:2021 deaths Category:Saudi Arabian businesspeople Category:French businesspeople Category:Organ transplant recipients Category:Deaths from idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis
title: Mansour Ojjeh
